meanings.definition: A type of inflorescence in which the main axis bears a single central flower that develops first, with lateral branches developing successively below it.
meanings.sent1: The cyme on the plant had a central flower that bloomed first.
meanings.sent2: The gardener admired the cyme of the daisy as it bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The cyme seemed like a floral staircase with flowers blooming step by step.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a cyme of colors, each flower a different note in a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The cyme of roses in the garden was a sight to behold, like a floral crown on nature's head.

meanings.definition: A flat-topped or convex flower cluster in which the central or terminal flower opens first.
meanings.sent1: The cyme of daisies in the field had a central flower that opened first.
meanings.sent2: The florist arranged the cyme of carnations in a beautiful bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The cyme of sunflowers looked like a sunny pancake stack in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The cyme of daffodils was a burst of sunshine in the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The cyme of tulips in the vase brought a pop of color to the room, like a floral fireworks display.
